intro: Ischaemum arenosum, commonly known as sandgrass, is a flowering plant native to sandy and coastal environments. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its low-growing, tufted habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are narrow,坚韧, and adapted to withstand harsh, dry conditions. Ischaemum arenosum plays an important role in stabilizing sand dunes and preventing erosion in coastal areas.
